methods.name: types
title: Google
Cloud
Spanner
Results#types
methods.description: Indicates the field names and types for the rows in the returned data.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/spanner"

spanner = Google::Cloud::Spanner.new

db = spanner.client "my-instance", "my-database"

results = db.execute "SELECT * FROM users"

results.types.each do |name, type|
  puts "Column #{name} is type {type}"
end

examples.caption: Can return an array of array pairs instead of a hash
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/spanner"

spanner = Google::Cloud::Spanner.new

db = spanner.client "my-instance", "my-database"

results = db.execute "SELECT 1 AS count, 2 AS count"

results.types(pairs: true).each do |row|
  row #=> [[:count, :INT64], [:count, :INT64]]
end

params.name: pairs
params.description: Allow the types to be represented as a nested Array of pairs rather than a Hash. This is useful when results have duplicate names. The default is false.

returns.description: The types of the returned data. The default is a Hash. Is a nested Array of Arrays when pairs is specified.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/spanner"

spanner = Google::Cloud::Spanner.new

db = spanner.client "my-instance", "my-database"

results = db.execute "SELECT * FROM users"

results.rows.each do |row|
  puts "User #{row[:id]} is #{row[:name]}""
end

examples.caption: Can returns an array of array pairs instead of a hash
examples.code:
require "google/cloud/spanner"

spanner = Google::Cloud::Spanner.new

db = spanner.client "my-instance", "my-database"

results = db.execute "SELECT 1 AS count, 2 AS count"

results.rows(pairs: true).each do |row|
  row #=> [[:count, 1], [:count, 2]]
end

params.name: pairs
params.description: Allow the rows to be represented as a nested Array of pairs rather than a Hash. This is useful when results have duplicate names. The default is false.

params.name: yield.row
params.description:
a hash that contains the result names
and values. Or, if pairs was specified, an array of arrays.

methods.name: transaction
title: Google
Cloud
Spanner
Results#transaction
methods.description: Identifier of the transaction results were run in. Single-use read-only transactions do not have IDs, because single-use transactions do not support multiple requests.
